\( \newcommand{\setu}[2]{#1 \cup #2} \) \( \newcommand{\seti}[2]{#1 \cap #2} \) \( \newcommand{\setd}[2]{#1 \setminus #2} \)
Counting
Sum Rule If two tasks can be performed in $m$ and $n$ ways, respectively, then there are $m+n$ ways of doing either. Product Rule If two sequential tasks can be performed in $m$ and $n$ ways, respectively, there are $m \times n$ ways of performing the sequence.
Permutations
Given $n$ objects, any linear arrangement of these is a permutation. With permutations order matters and repetitions are not allowed.
The number of permutations of size $r$ a set of $n$ objects is $P(n,r) = \frac{n!}{(n-r)!}$.
Permutations with Repetition
Given $n$ objects, with $n_1$ objects of type 1, $n_2$ objects of type 2, etc. where $n_1 + ... + n_r = n$, the number of permutations with repetitions is $PR(n) = \frac{n!}{n_1!n_2!...n_r!}$.
Combinations
Given $n$ objects, the number of subsets (Combinations) of size $r$ is $C(n,r) = \frac{P(n,r)}{r!}$. Combinations don't preserve order.
Binomial Theorem
Given a positive integer $n$: $(x+y)^n = \sum_{k=0}^n C(n,k)x^ky^{n-k}$.
Multinomial Theorem
The coefficient of $x_1^{n_1}...x_t^{n_t}$ in $(x_1 + ... + x_t)^n$ is $\frac{n!}{n_1!n_2!...n_t!}$.
Combinations with Repetition
$CR(n,r) = C(n+r-1, r)$.
The number of combinations with repetitions of $n$ objects in sets of size $r$ is the same as:
The number of integer solutions to the equation $x_1 + ... + x_n = r, x_i \gt 0$.
The number of ways to distribute $r$ identical objects in $n$ distinct containers.
Catalan Numbers
Not exactly sure why these are useful. $b_n = \frac{1}{n+1}C(2n,n)$.
Set Theory
The number of subsets of $A$ is $2^\card{A}$. The number of subsets of size $k$ is $C(n,k)$.
Operations
Union $\setu{A}{B} = \set{x | x \in A \lor x \in B}$ Intersection $\seti{A}{B} = \set{x | x \in A \land x \in B}$ Difference $\setd{A}{B} = \set{x | x \in A \land x \not \in B}$
Properties
Disjoint $A \cap B = \emptyset$ Powerset Set of all subsets, $\powerset{A}$. Cardinality of the powerset $\card{\powerset{A}} = 2^\card{A}$
Tuples
Projection The nth of a tuple $s$ is $\proj{s}{n}$. Cartesian product $A \times B = \set{\tup{x,y} | a \in A \land b \in B}$ Cardinality of the Cartesian product $\card{A \times B} = \card{A} \times \card{B}$
Relations
A relation of $A$ is a subset of $A \times A$.
Properties Reflexive $\rel{a}{a}, \forall a \in A$ Symmetric $\rel{a_1}{a_2} \rightarrow \rel{a_2}{a_1}, \forall a_1, a_2 \in A$ Antisymmetric $\rel{a_1}{a_2}, \rel{a_2}{a_1} \rightarrow a_1 = a_2, \forall a_1, a_2 \in A$ Transitive $\rel{a_1}{a_2}, \rel{a_2}{a_3} \rightarrow \rel{a_1}{a_3}, \forall a_1, a_2, a_3 \in A$
